result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrick L Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Hit and Run-Injury, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit for 2 days were granted.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to Costs/DNA Surcharge.  Remainder of Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

No contact with Heather Evans.
Driver Safety Program.
Cannot drive without a valid driver's license or insurance.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Restitution Hearing scheduled for November 22, 2016 at 2:30 p.m.
AMENDED 12/21/2016:  RESTITUTION IN THE AMOUNT OF $7259.77 TO BE PAID TO HEATHER EVANS. BAIL APPLIED TO RESTITUTION.  REMAINDER OF RESTITUTION AMOUNT AND TIME TO BE PAID TO BE DETERMINED BY PROBATION AND PAROLE.  ANY UNPAID AMOUNT TO BE CONVERTED TO A JUDGMENT IN FAVOR OF MS. EVANS AT THE TERMINATION OF PROBATION.

timeConds.notes: Huber with non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED for use at Agent's discretion.

Defendant Darrick L Miller in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   Victor Harding appeared with victim Heather Evans.  Attorney Benedict makes statements regarding the restitution request.  Court orders restitution be paid in the amount of $7259.77 to Heather Evans, amount and time to be paid to be determined by probation and parole.  Any unpaid amount to be converted to a Judgment in favor of Ms. Evans at the termination of probation.  Court waives the costs and the DNA surcharge previously ordered.  JOC to be amended.

Defendant Darrick L Miller in court with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim makes statements.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Benedict makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1. 

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

6 months Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 2 days).  

Term of Probation: 1 Year

Conditions of Probation:

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
	
No contact with Heather Evans .

Driver safty program

Cannot drive without a valid drivers license or insurance

Condition Time: 15 days Huber with NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion

Restitution: Hearing scheduled, information to be delivered to the defense on or before 11/7/2016.  State is released from representing the victim at this hearing. 

COSTS:  $268.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  
  Restitution hearing scheduled for November 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on September 28, 2016 at 10:30 am.
